00014 #ifndef ULIB_RPC_ENCODER_H
00015 #define ULIB_RPC_ENCODER_H 1
00016 
00017 #include <ulib/net/rpc/rpc_fault.h>
00018 #include <ulib/net/rpc/rpc_method.h>
00019 #include <ulib/utility/string_ext.h>
00020 
00021 #define U_ENCODER_CLEAR_DATA                    URPCMethod::encoder->clearData()
00022 #define U_RPC_ENCODE_ARG(arg)                   URPCMethod::encoder->encodeArgument(UString::getStringNull(), UString::getStringNull(), arg)
00023 #define U_RPC_ENCODE_RES(tok,res)       URPCMethod::encoder->encodeResponse(tok, res)
00024 
00029 class U_EXPORT URPCEncoder {
00030 public:
00031 
00032         // Check for memory error
00033         U_MEMORY_TEST
00034 
00035         // Allocator e Deallocator
00036         U_MEMORY_ALLOCATOR
00037         U_MEMORY_DEALLOCATOR
00038 
00039         // COSTRUTTORI
00040 
00041         URPCEncoder() : buffer(U_CAPACITY), encodedValue(U_CAPACITY)
00042                 {
00043                 U_TRACE_REGISTER_OBJECT(0, URPCEncoder, "", 0)
00044 
00045                 bIsResponse = false;
00046                 }
00047 
00048         virtual ~URPCEncoder()
00049                 {
00050                 U_TRACE_UNREGISTER_OBJECT(0, URPCEncoder)
00051                 }
00052 
00053         // dipendenze di USOAPParser...
00054 
00055         void clearData()
00056                 {
00057                 U_TRACE(0, "URPCEncoder::clearData()")
00058 
00059                 arg.clear();
00060 
00061                                 buffer.setEmptyForce();
00062                 encodedValue.setEmptyForce();
00063                 }
00064 
00065         // Used to indicate if the encoder is currently closing a response
00066 
00067         bool isEncodingResponse() const { return bIsResponse; }
00068 
00069         // ENCODING FUNCTIONS
00070 
00071         virtual void encodeArgument(const UString& argName, const UString& argType, const UString& argContent)
00072                 {
00073                 U_TRACE(0, "URPCEncoder::encodeArgument(%.*S,%.*S,%.*S)", U_STRING_TO_TRACE(argName),
00074                                                                                                                                                                          U_STRING_TO_TRACE(argType),
00075                                                                                                                                                                          U_STRING_TO_TRACE(argContent))
00076 
00077                 if (     argName.empty() == false) arg.push(argName);
00078                 if (     argType.empty() == false) arg.push(argType);
00079                 if (argContent.empty() == false) arg.push(argContent);
00080                 }
00081 
00082         void encodeArgument(const UString& argName, const UString& argType, bool value)
00083                 {
00084                 U_TRACE(0, "URPCEncoder::encodeArgument(%.*S,%.*S,%b)", U_STRING_TO_TRACE(argName), U_STRING_TO_TRACE(argType), value)
00085 
00086                 buffer.snprintf("%d", value);
00087 
00088                 encodeArgument(argName, argType, buffer);
00089                 }
00090 
00091         void encodeArgument(const UString& argName, const UString& argType, char value)
00092                 {
00093                 U_TRACE(0, "URPCEncoder::encodeArgument(%.*S,%.*S,%C)", U_STRING_TO_TRACE(argName), U_STRING_TO_TRACE(argType), value)
00094 
00095                 buffer.snprintf("%c", value);
00096 
00097                 encodeArgument(argName, argType, buffer);
00098                 }
00099 
00100         void encodeArgument(const UString& argName, const UString& argType, unsigned char value)
00101                 {
00102                 U_TRACE(0, "URPCEncoder::encodeArgument(%.*S,%.*S,%C)", U_STRING_TO_TRACE(argName), U_STRING_TO_TRACE(argType), value)
00103 
00104                 buffer.snprintf("%c", value);
00105 
00106                 encodeArgument(argName, argType, buffer);
00107                 }
00108 
00109         void encodeArgument(const UString& argName, const UString& argType, short value)
00110                 {
00111                 U_TRACE(0, "URPCEncoder::encodeArgument(%.*S,%.*S,%d)", U_STRING_TO_TRACE(argName), U_STRING_TO_TRACE(argType), value)
00112 
00113                 buffer.snprintf("%d", value);
00114 
00115                 encodeArgument(argName, argType, buffer);
00116                 }

00122                 buffer.snprintf("%d", value);
00123 
00124                 encodeArgument(argName, argType, buffer);

00140                 buffer.snprintf("%u", value);
00141

00190         void encodeArgument(const UString& argName, const UString& argType, const double& value)
00191                 {
00192                 U_TRACE(0, "URPCEncoder::encodeArgument(%.*S,%.*S,%g)", U_STRING_TO_TRACE(argName), U_STRING_TO_TRACE(argType), value)
00193 
00194                 buffer.snprintf("%g", value);

00197                 }
00198 
00199         // Given a method, turns it into a message
00200 
00201         UString encodeMethodCall(URPCMethod& method, const UString& nsName)
00202                 {
00203                 U_TRACE(0, "URPCEncoder::encodeMethodCall(%p,%.*S)", &method, U_STRING_TO_TRACE(nsName))
00204 
00205                 bIsResponse = false;
00206 
00207                 return encodeMethod(method, nsName);
00208                 }
00209 
00210         UString encodeMethodResponse(URPCMethod& method, const UString& nsName)
00211                 {
00212                 U_TRACE(0, "URPCEncoder::encodeMethodResponse(%p,%.*S)", &method, U_STRING_TO_TRACE(nsName))
00213 
00214                 bIsResponse = true;
00215 
00216                 return encodeMethod(method, nsName);
00217                 }
00218 
00219         void encodeResponse(const char* token, const UString& response)
00220                 {
00221                 U_TRACE(0, "URPCEncoder::encodeResponse(%S,%.*S)", token, U_STRING_TO_TRACE(response))
00222 
00223                 encodedValue.setBuffer(response.size() + U_TOKEN_LN);
00224 
00225                 UStringExt::buildTokenString(token, response, encodedValue);
00226                 }
00227 
00228         // Encodes the complete fault into a complete URPCEnvelope
00229 
00230         virtual UString encodeFault(URPCFault* fault)
00231                 {
00232                 U_TRACE(0, "URPCEncoder::encodeFault(%p)", fault)
00233 
00234                 fault->encode(buffer); // Encode the fault
00235 
00236                 U_RPC_ENCODE_RES(URPCMethod::str_fault->data(), buffer);
00237 
00238                 U_RETURN_STRING(encodedValue);
00239                 }
00240 
00241         // DEBUG
00242 
00243 #ifdef DEBUG
00244         const char* dump(bool reset) const;
00245 #endif
00246 
00247 protected:
00248         UString buffer,
00249                           encodedValue; // Keeps the value of the encoded string as this object
00250                                                                  // moves itself throughout the encoding process
00251         UVector<UString> arg; // this contains the argument for the method the caller wants to execute to encode
00252         bool bIsResponse;     // Remembers if this item is encoding a response
00253 
00254         // Called by the encodeMethodResponse and encodeMethodCall members to finish encoding the method.
00255         // As you may guess, the two methods share a lot, and this item holds that common code
00256 
00257         virtual UString encodeMethod(URPCMethod& method, const UString& nsName); // namespace qualified element information
00258 
00259 private:
00260         URPCEncoder(const URPCEncoder&)            {}
00261         URPCEncoder& operator=(const URPCEncoder&) { return *this; }
00262 };
